description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4si3p","text":"This protocol is useful if you wish to sync a LARGE reference library across multiple computers. It uses Zotero, which has built-in free syncing for up to 300 MB of files (roughly 50-100 papers). For larger libraries, it can make sense to use other cloud storage services to store and sync files. This protocol uses Google Drive, Windows PC, and Google Chrome.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5a8v9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2t2e3","text":"Zotero is free, open-source, powerful, and has an active user forum.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":6}],"data":{}},{"key":"2guoq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bktmm","text":"I made this protocol for internal lab use (and my own reference), but welcome feedback if it's used by others!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"DB71CAB0A8B811EDA036778AC6B6F415","url":"https://www.zotero.org/"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.section: Set up Google Drive syncing
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4vo38","text":"Install Drive for desktop on both computers","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":17}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"BBBEE860A8AE11ED942D19F194F0DC02","url":"https://www.google.com/drive/download/"}}}}

steps.section: Install and set up Zotero on Computer 1
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"pbi5","text":"Install Zotero desktop","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":6}],"data":{}},{"key":"a3leg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9osf4","text":"Default installation settings are fine.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"C4EA3560A8AF11ED942D19F194F0DC02","url":"https://www.zotero.org/download/"}}}}

steps.section: Install and set up Zotero on Computer 2
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9nirp","text":"Repeat the steps above for your second computer","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3m5mk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"72jrt","text":"If you do not have a prior (e.g., Mendeley) library saved, OR if your library was previously synced between the two computers, you can skip steps 6 and 8.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"392tg","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1dqcq","text":"Congratulations — your libraries should now be synced across computers!","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Set up Google Drive syncing
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"6tu7h","text":"Create a Google Drive folder that will store your synced library files, e.g., Google Drive G:/My Drive/papers_synced","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":78,"length":38}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"as1cs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ah5j3","text":"This folder will be referred to as your Google Drive synced library file folder for the remainder of the protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":40,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Set up Google Drive syncing
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2d4qa","text":"On both computers, set your Google Drive synced library file folder to Offline Access: Right click on the folder, select Offline access \u003e Available Offline","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":28,"length":39},{"style":"italic","offset":121,"length":14},{"style":"italic","offset":138,"length":17}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6v960","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1218v","text":"This will store the paper files locally on each computer so that you can access them when you are offline.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Install and set up Zotero on Computer 1
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"32hqq","text":"Configure Zotero to link saved citations to the files in your Google Drive synced library file folder","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":62,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Install and set up Zotero on Computer 1
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2po2o","text":"In Zotero, go to Edit \u003e Preferences","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":17,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":24,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Install and set up Zotero on Computer 1
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3cuva","text":"Under General \u003e File Handling, deselect Automatically rename attachment files using parent metadata","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":6,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":16,"length":13},{"style":"italic","offset":40,"length":59}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"50e0j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8dcp9","text":"Later, you will use Zotfile to handle attachment (pdf and other files) naming instead of using Zotero.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b2ql1","text":"All other default settings under General are fine.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Install and set up Zotero on Computer 1
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"a6rbk","text":"Under Sync \u003e Data Syncing, deselect Sync full-text content","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":6,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":13,"length":12},{"style":"italic","offset":36,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ef136","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a0avc","text":"You may need to log into Zotero in order to access the full sync menu. Just make sure that once you've logged in, to not click 'Okay' until the following steps (5.4-5.6) are done.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d936k","text":"This will prevent Zotero from uploading pdf and other file attachments to its cloud, which will quickly fill up.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4adie","text":"Keep Sync automatically selected. This will use Zotero to sync metadata for your citations in its cloud and prevent corrupting those references. Because the metadata files are tiny, the 300 MB Zotero free storage limit essentially means you can sync as many metadata references as you want.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":5,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Install and set up Zotero on Computer 1
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"ebn43","text":"Under Sync \u003e File Syncing, deselect Sync attachment files in My Library using...","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":6,"length":4},{"style":"italic","offset":13,"length":12},{"style":"italic","offset":36,"length":44}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3knj1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bgl5b","text":"This, again, will ensure that Zotero doesn't try to upload your pdf and other file attachments to its cloud.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"95to","text":"You may want to keep Sync attachment files in group libraries using Zotero storage selected if you ever plan to collaborate with others on Zotero libraries. This will use up your Zotero cloud space, but if your collaborating groups don't plan on having dozens of shared files, that should be okay. Otherwise, you won't be able to share files across your groups.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":21,"length":61},{"style":"italic","offset":162,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Install and set up Zotero on Computer 1
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"39qa2","text":"Under Advanced \u003e Files and Folders \u003e Linked Attachment Base Directory, set Base Directory to the location of your Google Drive synced library file folder","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":6,"length":9},{"style":"italic","offset":17,"length":18},{"style":"italic","offset":37,"length":32},{"style":"italic","offset":75,"length":14},{"style":"bold","offset":114,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a5kdr","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ejau3","text":"This will tell Zotero to look for the pdf and other attachment files in the synced Google Drive folder","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Install and set up Zotero on Computer 1
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9siej","text":"Under Advanced \u003e Files and Folders \u003e Data Directory Location, set the Data Directory Location to wherever you want Zotero to save the reference metadata, which it will sync in Zotero's cloud. The Default option is fine.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":6,"length":9},{"style":"italic","offset":17,"length":18},{"style":"italic","offset":37,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Install and set up Zotero on Computer 1
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c0kvp","text":"Install and configure the ZotFile plugin","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b5jc8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a6rjj","text":"ZotFile will ensure that the references you add will be stored where they belong, and will give them names that allow you to look for the files easily.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Install and set up Zotero on Computer 1
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"21obl","text":"Download ZotFile as a *.xpi file","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":9,"length":7}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"130F1000A8B311ED942D19F194F0DC02","url":"http://zotfile.com/"}}}}

steps.section: Install and set up Zotero on Computer 1
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"64ogm","text":"In Zotero, go to Tools \u003e Add-ons \u003e Settings (the gear icon) \u003e Install Add-on From File and select the ZotFile *.xpi file you just downloaded","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":17,"length":5},{"style":"italic","offset":25,"length":7},{"style":"italic","offset":35,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":62,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"89vsi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a33dn","text":"This will install the ZotFile plugin","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cls2o","text":"When it is installed, you can close the Add-ons window","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":40,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Install and set up Zotero on Computer 1
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9p4p4","text":"Restart Zotero","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Install and set up Zotero on Computer 1
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"dmm98","text":"In Zotero, go to Tools \u003e ZotFile Preferences \u003e General Settings and set Location of Files to Custom Location, setting your file location to your Google Drive synced library file folder","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":17,"length":5},{"style":"italic","offset":25,"length":19},{"style":"italic","offset":47,"length":17},{"style":"italic","offset":72,"length":17},{"style":"italic","offset":93,"length":15},{"style":"bold","offset":145,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1ac7f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"888qn","text":"Zotfile will now manage all added attachments (pdfs and other files) by storing them in your synced Drive folder.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cjvbj","text":"You can also modify the Source Folder for Attaching New Files, which just tells ZotFile where to look if you're trying to add new files, I think, though I'm not totally sure.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Install and set up Zotero on Computer 1
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"1mpsl","text":"In the ZotFile Preferences window, go to Renaming Rules and set your file naming rules to whatever makes sense to you","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":41,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"291up","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"drt96","text":"I use {%a - }{%y - }{%t} with Truncate title after . or : or ?, Maximum length of title = 30, Maximum number of authors = 2, and Add suffix when authors are omitted = et al, which, for example, saved the pdf associated with the reference below as Frantz et al - 2015 - Grain trapping by filamentous.pdf","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":6,"length":18},{"style":"italic","offset":30,"length":32},{"style":"italic","offset":64,"length":23},{"style":"italic","offset":94,"length":25},{"style":"italic","offset":129,"length":35},{"style":"italic","offset":247,"length":55}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f1p07","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4egc6","text":"Frantz, C. M., Petryshyn, V. A., \u0026 Corsetti, F. A. (2015). Grain trapping by filamentous cyanobacterial and algal mats: Implications for stromatolite microfabrics through time. Geobiology, 13(5), 409–423. https://doi.org/10.1111/gbi.12145","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":177,"length":10},{"style":"italic","offset":189,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":205,"length":33}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"88F27FBAA8B511EDA7F80A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://doi.org/10.1111/gbi.12145"}}}}

steps.section: Install and set up Zotero on Computer 1
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"c5ies","text":"In Zotero, rename and move your files into the synced folder","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2ml9a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"arnbj","text":"If you imported files from a prior library, you will need to do this step. Otherwise, this should happen automatically as you add new files in the future.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Install and set up Zotero on Computer 1
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bi64b","text":"Sort your files by attachment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Install and set up Zotero on Computer 1
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"749gf","text":"Select all the files that have an attachment","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Install and set up Zotero on Computer 1
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4e7mr","text":"Right click your selected files, then select Manage Attachments \u003e Rename and Move","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":45,"length":19},{"style":"italic","offset":66,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eck1m","text":"If you get a warning message telling you that there are a lot of files and it will take a while, select okay","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4i6q6","text":"This will go through and rename all of the files associated with bibliographic entries using the renaming rules you set up through ZotFile, and then will move them into your  Google Drive synced library file folder, where they will then be synced to the cloud.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":175,"length":39}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Install and set up Zotero on Computer 1
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"7okug","text":"Import an old library from the bibliography management program you used to use","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"afodt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"duoga","text":"Skip this if you have never used Mendeley or a prior reference management program before and are starting with Zotero.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fbs4h","text":"If you are moving your library to Zotero from an old reference management program, e.g., Mendeley, select File \u003e Import and use the import wizard to import your old files.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":106,"length":5},{"style":"italic","offset":113,"length":6}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ah3c6","text":"This can take a long time if you have a big library. Wait for it to finish before continuing with any additional installations or settings changes.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":16,"length":4}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Using Zotero
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2vats","text":"Install Zotero Chrome Connector to easily import and download new files","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":8,"length":23}],"data":{}},{"key":"a76m9","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7n5lb","text":"This is the best way to add new references: just navigate to the paper's webpage, wait for the Zotero icon in Chrome to turn blue (indicating that it has access to the paper's metadata), then click it to automatically add the citation to Zotero and, if possible, download the pdf.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3g09q","text":"If you can't automatically download the pdf (e.g., the library doesn't have access and you need to do to ILL request to get it), you can later download the file manually and drag and drop it into the Zotero reference entry.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"35ojs","text":"The Zotero Chrome Connector also interfaces directly with Google Docs, allowing you to add and automatically update citations in your Google Docs papers.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"3E577040A8B811ED942D19F194F0DC02","url":"https://www.zotero.org/download/"}}}}

steps.section: Using Zotero
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"feh5v","text":"When you installed Zotero, it should have automatically installed the plugin for Microsoft Word, allowing you to add and automatically update citations and bibliography lists when writing in Word.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Setting up Zotero and Google Drive for syncing reference libraries (PC)
